snippet: Shutting the troubled New York City jail complex has been considered before, but major issues — reducing the population, community opposition to new jails, financing — are still there.
abstract: Number of skeptics, including New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, have raised questions about plans to shutter Rikers Island prison complex, which has been brought up both by New York Gov Andrew M CUomo and City Council Speaker Melissa Mark-Viverito; main obstacle is that it would take many years, billions of dollars and large amount of political capital to execute any such plan.

byline.original: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and MICHAEL WINERIP

lead_paragraph: Shutting the troubled New York City jail complex has been considered before, but major issues — reducing the population, community opposition to new jails, financing — are still there.

headline.main: Close Rikers Island? It Will Take Years, Billions and Political Capital
headline.print_headline: Shut Rikers Island? It Will Take Time, Money and Political Capital
